ygData.subject: Fractional H atoms
ygData.msgSnippet: One could consider fractional product stoichiometric coefficients to be the probability resulting from the branching ratios associated with multiple product

One could consider fractional product stoichiometric coefficients to be the probability resulting 
from the branching ratios associated with multiple product pathways from the collision partners. 
The reverse rate of such a global reaction would obviously be wrong since you are not dealing with a 
true elementary reaction.  You could of course specify each product pathway and rate individually 
with integer stoichiometric coefficients.  The result is the same as long as the reactions are 
forward only.
